Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to signage regarding patient rights and hospital services for transgender individuals
Items.MatterName: Signage regarding patient rights and hospital services for transgender individuals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to report on training provided by hospitals regarding medical care for transgender individuals
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to report on training provided by hospitals regarding medical care for transgender individuals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to an outreach campaign to inform parents and legal guardians about their rights in relation to child care
Items.MatterName: An outreach campaign to inform parents and legal guardians about their rights in relation to child care.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting on training for child care inspectors
Items.MatterName: Reporting on training for child care inspectors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to training for medical personnel in public schools and reporting on participation in such training
Items.MatterName: Training for medical personnel in public schools and reporting on participation in such training.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Assembly to pass, A.3899A, and the Governor to sign, S.6225/A.3899A, which would tighten regulations, enhance inspections, and provide training and resources to day care providers and parents to ensure the safety of children in child day care homes, programs, and facilities across New York State
Items.MatterName: Tighten regulations, enhance inspections, and provide training and resources to day care providers and parents to ensure the safety of children in child day care homes, programs, and facilities across New York State (A.3899-A and S.6225/A.3899-A).

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to cooling centers
